result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Case called at 9:03 AM 
District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Adam N Schultz in court, in custody by phone from the Waukesha County Jail, with attorney Angela Wang for attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   
Attorney Wang is requesting that Cash Bail be LOWERED.
State objects.  
Court will MODIFY the Cash Bond to a Signature Bond in the amount of $5,000.00
CONDITIONS:

Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:26 AM Defendant Adam N Schultz in court, in custody, with attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Attorney Nimmer previously filed a motion to modify bail.  The Court will set a bail hearing before the Trial Court as well as give a further proceedings date to tag along with the defendant's other matter.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
